input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:

2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value

scope_of_work.problem: The switchrooms are constructed of GRP, are 16 years old and have become brittle with fractures at high level and deterioration of seals at low level causing water ingress
scope_of_work.scope: Install measured tarpaulins across each of 3 roofs fixed to existing structures. Prepare and install Hydrosil Heavy Duty Reinforcement Roll (Polyester Fabric) to internal and external low level joints and apply heavy duty Hydrosil Silicone roof coating
scope_of_work.justification: Prevent water ingress to critical switchrooms
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Water ingress will remain a constant issue, a tripping hazard and possible water infiltration to switchgear

input.project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Sprinkler Diesel Pump Repair Works
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Brando Dooley DDS (2):work planning by Miss Maymie Sporer (3):offer approved by Miss Maymie Sporer (4):offer submitted by Miss Maymie Sporer (5):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: As part of the planned maintenance service of the Sprinkler Pump, CBRE  representative was informed by the specialist contractor of a fuel leak on the diesel pump set. On inspection this was found to be coming from a pinhole that has occurred on the fuel lift pump. The specialist contractor highly recommended that the fuel lift pump is replaced before the leak deteriorates further and puts the pump out of action. We currently have an Impairment raised with FM Global to only use the pump set in the event of an Emergency, Weekly testing has had to be put on hold until this issue is resolved
scope_of_work.scope:
Specialist contractor to attend site and carry out the following works, -
Replace fuel lift pump and gasket.
• Replace drive belt guard anti vibration mounts.
• Install discharge pressure gauge and adapter by way of stud welding.
• Install suction gauge and adapter by way of stud welding.
• Replace engine coolant hoses and clips.
• Replace engine thermostat and gasket.
• Remove water pump for inspection.
• Replace engine drive belt.
• Replace air filter.
• Replace heat exchanger pressure cap.
• Carry out chemical coolant flush.
• Dispose of old coolant and refill with new to 50/50 mix.
• Carry out a calibrated digital flow test (Druck test).
scope_of_work.justification: Without the lift pump operating correctly, this will fail to pump/transmit the fuel from the tank to the main injection pump adequately and will compromise the operation of the fuel injection pump over a period of time.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Non-approval will overtime lead to a total failure and will result in potential engine failure and working sprinkler system this will create a major life safety issue if we were to lose our Sprinkler system in its entirety

input.associated_items: the assositated items with their boolean values are mentioned: As Builts (No), EANS/CMMS Update (No), O&M Manuals (No), Job Punch List (No), Health & Safety Form (EPIC Form) (No), Single Source Approval (No), Close-Out Checklist (Yes)

output.overview: Project 'UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Sprinkler Diesel Pump Repair Works' is located in United Kingdom at site N/A, managed by Qwerty for client Kyndryl. Prepared by Brando Dooley DDS under internal work order UK-EW-05042023-5958. Current status is 'Work Order Closed'.
output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: As part of the planned maintenance service of the Sprinkler Pump, CBRE  representative was informed by the specialist contractor of a fuel leak on the diesel pump set. On inspection this was found to be coming from a pinhole that has occurred on the fuel lift pump. The specialist contractor highly recommended that the fuel lift pump is replaced before the leak deteriorates further and puts the pump out of action. We currently have an Impairment raised with FM Global to only use the pump set in the event of an Emergency, Weekly testing has had to be put on hold until this issue is resolved. The defined scope of work includes: Specialist contractor to attend site and carry out the following works, -
Replace fuel lift pump and gasket.
• Replace drive belt guard anti vibration mounts.
• Install discharge pressure gauge and adapter by way of stud welding.
• Install suction gauge and adapter by way of stud welding.
• Replace engine coolant hoses and clips.
• Replace engine thermostat and gasket.
• Remove water pump for inspection.
• Replace engine drive belt.
• Replace air filter.
• Replace heat exchanger pressure cap.
• Carry out chemical coolant flush.
• Dispose of old coolant and refill with new to 50/50 mix.
• Carry out a calibrated digital flow test (Druck test).. The justification provided is: Without the lift pump operating correctly, this will fail to pump/transmit the fuel from the tank to the main injection pump adequately and will compromise the operation of the fuel injection pump over a period of time.. If not approved, the effect would be: Non-approval will overtime lead to a total failure and will result in potential engine failure and working sprinkler system this will create a major life safety issue if we were to lose our Sprinkler system in its entirety.

input.project_name: UPM-DRUPS Low Voltage Switchroom Roof & Low Level Water Ingress Protection
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Jayme Feil

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: The switchroom is constructed of GRP, are 16 years old and have become brittle with fractures at high level and deterioration of seals at low level causing water ingress
scope_of_work.scope: Install measured tarpaulins across Switchroom 1 & Shortbreak fixed to existing structures. Prepare and install Hydrosil Heavy Duty Reinforcement Roll (Polyester Fabric) to internal and external low level joints to Switchrooms 1, 2, 3 & Shortbreak and apply heavy duty Hydrosil Silicone roof coating
scope_of_work.justification: Prevent water ingress to critical switchrooms
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Water ingress will remain a constant issue, a tripping hazard and possible water infiltration to LV switchgear

output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: The switchroom is constructed of GRP, are 16 years old and have become brittle with fractures at high level and deterioration of seals at low level causing water ingress. The defined scope of work includes: Install measured tarpaulins across Switchroom 1 & Shortbreak fixed to existing structures. Prepare and install Hydrosil Heavy Duty Reinforcement Roll (Polyester Fabric) to internal and external low level joints to Switchrooms 1, 2, 3 & Shortbreak and apply heavy duty Hydrosil Silicone roof coating. The justification provided is: Prevent water ingress to critical switchrooms. If not approved, the effect would be: Water ingress will remain a constant issue, a tripping hazard and possible water infiltration to LV switchgear.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):rejected by Marge Hills (3):offer submitted by Marge Hills (4):work in progress by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Following DRUPS 4 remedial works load bank testing was completed which used an amount of fuel. Therefore there is insufficient fuel to provide the required runtime hours in the event DRUPS 4 is called in to service.
scope_of_work.scope: Fuel top up of 10000 ltrs is to be completed
scope_of_work.justification: This top up is required to provide sufficient runtime on DRUPS 4
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: There will be reduced runtime availability on DRUPS 4.
